title: I hope Taric rework can still go solo top and outdamage Riven every time.
body: Rito please don't force him to support only.

replies.body: "Can go top and outdamage Riven" is probably not near as much of a reasonable expectation as "isn't forced into support only." I think I've mentioned this elsewhere, but I'm doing his upcoming gameplay update and have no real issues with him being playable in roles outside of support. That said, he will most likely be balanced to be played in the support position, but I'd like people to be able to have fun and win with him elsewhere if it's not compromising his overall power level.

Speaking of which,Is it alright if I can ask what is your opinion of Champs & the number of roles/position they can play?
Is it good that champs can be play in multiple position?Or is better if they can only work in one place?Or is it something that varies from champ to champ?

I personally think it's cool if champions are played in multiple positions. I can see why the balance team might think it's less cool. I don't think it's a reasonable expectation that a character equally viable in two separate positions, but if the margin is small enough that top Taric can be played to some success despite support Taric technically being stronger, then that's cool by me.

Okay I see,I always saw giving champs the option to play more than one role more as an option of fun rather than an option of viability.
I don't think players want Taric top to be as good as Taric sup in terms of viability,but they want to have the choice to take him to a different role,play him a little differently than intended & finding some success with it.Garen was designed to be played Top,but that's not going to stop people from playing him in the jungle.Would he be the best option in terms of viability?No.Does Jg Garen have to be a priority when balancing him?Unless he's completely OP in the Jungle role & pushing out regular Junglers,nope.It just a fun side option that's different.
But some champs are "forced" to go to one role & have the fun options removed because of how Riot balanced them.This happens to a good number of supports,which is why people here are worried for Taric & his top lane capabilities.

I think the idea of "equally viable" is wrong to begin with even in the same position.

Champs are always stronger than others in specific situations. And a large part of those "specific situations" is simply whether the player has practiced with this champ.

Usually those champs that can be played in different positions often have different, not necessarily connected but strong scalings. They change depending on which scaling you support with items.

Taric is such a champ, please don't take that from him.

For example his armor scaling flat armor reduction and AD steroid make him a good AD Fighter, despite him scaling with AP otherwise.

And keep it flat reduction please. I'm already frustrated that you removed that from Soraka and changed it on Ryze. It's an inherently balanced mechanic. It can be abused, but also countered.

Top Lane is usually a bonus lane where you can choose to go more damage or tankish oriented and the use of TP might be of help for all the other lanes so a tankish/supp char would be good to have in-meta.

Annie is also mainly a midlaner, currently one of the best actually. She's played in midlane 2/3 of the time she's played and has 54% winrate there.
Zyra has been relegated to a pure support champion, as has Annie. They can work mid lane in low-elo games, sure, but so could mid Yorick.
Lol Annie is a pure support? What game are you playing?
When is the last time we saw any top team, or even kinda-sorta good team, pull out Annie mid?

Who said anything about teams? You were just talking about low-elo implying solo que. I see Annie mids in high gold/low plat. 

I have friends in diamond who still see Annie mids.

I guess I've internalized the whole "below diamond is still low-elo" thing, having reached gold myself last season and seen nothing to indicate actual significant skill.

Annie mid is great when the enemy isn't coordinated and doesn't maintain proper vision control. Her kit is currently balanced around bot lane, though.

So, I understand one of the objectives with champ updates is retain their identity but Taric is such an old and underplayed champ, why not change him up a bit? He seems like a good fit for a Juggernaut rework or a bot lane carry a la the new Morde.  We already have a ton of supports; whereas, the Juggernaut champ pool is holding strong at 4 (well, 5 if Gangplank is considered one). I guess what I'm asking is, what does Taric offer to the Support role that isn't filled by a current meta support or acceptable off-meta support?
if it's like lulu ( whose number are done for supp) it should be fine :p
I think if tarics gameplay identity is still built around sustain and single target lockdown, it would make sense if he was good at support and top.

Outdamage, probably not.  His rework form should counter her in lane though.  He should have a combination of a strong late game with good sustain and survival early to counter champs like riven, jayce, or fiora.
